title: What is a quadrilateral?A quadrilateral is a four-sided shape, where the sides are straight and meet at four vertices. The prefix “quad” means four. There are several types of quadrilaterals. Can you name them?Duration: 3 minutes 50 seconds3m 50s
subject: Maths

title: What is a triangle?A triangle is a three-sided shape, where the sides are straight and meet at three vertices. The prefix "tri" means three. There are several types of triangles. Do you know what they are?Duration: 3 minutes 42 seconds3m 42s
subject: Maths

title: What is an angle?An angle is formed when two straight lines, or rays, meet at a point, called a vertex. Angles are measured in degrees.Duration: 1 minute 54 seconds1m 54s
subject: Maths
